meanings.definition: Relating to a title or formal position.
meanings.sent1: The titulary ceremony was a grand event celebrating his new title.
meanings.sent2: The titulary document outlined the official roles and responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly referred to herself as the titulary queen of the household.
meanings.sent4: The titulary connection between the two leaders was evident in their formal greetings.
meanings.sent5: The titulary role of captain came with great respect and authority.

meanings.definition: A person who holds a title or formal position.
meanings.sent1: The titulary of the company was proud to represent the organization at the event.
meanings.sent2: The king's titulary was known throughout the kingdom for his wise decisions.
meanings.sent3: The titulary of puns in the office always kept everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: She became the titulary of the club, leading its members with grace and charm.
meanings.sent5: The titulary of the championship trophy proudly displayed it in the trophy case.
